title: China’s military parade: A direct message to Trump?
description: China flexed its military might, unveiling brand new nuclear and drone weapons systems. Chinese leader, Xi Jinping was flanked by the leaders of Russia and North Korea in a sign of unity against the West.
content:
The United States conducted a deadly military strike against an alleged drug boat tied to the cartel Tren de Aragua, President Donald Trump. The president said 11 people were killed in the strike in “international waters.” Secretary of State Marco Rubio described the “lethal strike” as taking place in the “southern Caribbean” against “a drug vessel which had departed from Venezuela.”

Russian President Vladimir Putin’s four-day visit to China marks a powerful show of unity with Chinese leader Xi Jinping - and is his longest foreign trip since the invasion of Ukraine. From summits to military parades, the two have underscored their personal rapport and shared ambition to reshape a global order they see as dominated by the West. CNN’s Simone McCarthy explores how Beijing and Moscow’s steadfast strategic alignment, despite recent diplomatic overtures between Moscow and Washington.

A fake Starbucks, Ikea lookalike products and a seaside resort fully stocked for tourists. CNN’s Will Ripley talks to some of the first international travelers to visit North Korea since the Covid-19 pandemic to find out what they saw.

Runners flock to Dubai malls to beat the heat With temperatures in the Gulf topping 50°C (around 120° Fahrenheit) this summer, people in Dubai found a way to stay fit. During the month of August, nine of the city’s biggest malls transformed into indoor running tracks. Organizers recorded more than 120 million steps - and the 'Mallathon' even secured a Guinness World Record for the most runners in a mall run event. CNN's Bijan Hosseini went to try it out. Runners flock to Dubai malls to beat the heat

Manchester United Superfan Frank Ilett has pledged not to cut his hair until his beloved Red Devils win 5 games in a row. Almost a year into the challenge, and CNN Sports’ Don Riddell has caught up with the now overly hirsute footy fan.
summary: The United States conducted a deadly military strike against an alleged drug boat tied to the cartel Tren de Aragua, killing 11 people. This comes as Russian President Vladimir Putin's four-day visit to China is his longest foreign trip since the invasion of Ukraine. The two leaders have shown their commitment to reshaping a global order they see as dominated by the West. Meanwhile, Dubai saw a Guinness World Record for the most runners in a mall run, with runners covering over 120 million steps during the summer.
shortSummary: A deadly US military strike against a drug boat tied to President Donald Trump, a strong China-Russia partnership, and a record-breaking Dubai Mallathon.

The two leaders discussed longevity and scientific advances as they made their way to Beijing’s Tiananmen Square for a landmark military parade on September 3.

argos_summary: The piece links a US strike on a drug vessel in the Caribbean with a broader narrative of geopolitical tension, highlighting President Trump's assertion of a lethal operation in international waters. It then shifts to Russia's extended visit to China, underscoring the growing military partnership between Xi Jinping and Vladimir Putin, who showcased new nuclear and drone capabilities amid a joint parade. The article frames these events as a coordinated challenge to Western influence, suggesting that China's display of force and Russia's diplomatic outreach serve as a direct message to the United States.
